text: hello this is chef john from food wishes
calm with Thomas Keller's cured lemons
who's Thomas Keller oh my god I can't
believe you asked that he's only like
America's top chef right now although
you can make that argument for about 20
people he is the man and I saw this
technique in Aspen and you may have read
about this actually in one of my food
wine classic in aspen recaps so anyway
as promised here is the cured lemon
technique make sure you have a very
sharp straight edged knife no serrated
knife that will tear the lemon and you
know how to use this steel to sharpen it
right if not I'll link the video where I
showed how to do that all right we're
going to take three Eureka lemons
not Meyer lemon just regular lemons
we're going to wash those in hot water
to get any wax off the surface and then
we're going to slice those very thin
length of an inch is that an eighth all
right once we have our three lemon slice
we're going to take the seeds out use a
small paring knife you're going to miss
a couple that's okay just get most of
them and then for our curing mixture
extremely easy half kosher salt half
sugar so you're going to mix that
together we're going to find a glass
container that has some kind of lid I'm
going to put a little layer of the salt
sugar at the bottom I'm going to put
some lemons on top of that another layer
of salt sugar another layer lemons
another layer salt sugar and so forth
okay and what happens here is not much
you're going to cover this and you're
going to let it sit out for three days
you just leave it on the counter like
you don't want this in the window but
pretty much anywhere in your kitchen
counter will be fine and you're going to
leave it for three days and the salt and
the sugar are going to basically cure
the lemons it's going to pull out liquid
it's going to kind of mellow out the
bitterness and it's going to intensify
that lemon flavor and these are a very
very cool thing to have around and we're
going to use these lots of cool
different ways in other videos but this
is how you start it now here you can see
after one day see all that liquids been
drawn out the sugar the salt has melted
and you want to make sure you have
enough to just cover the lemons okay so
if you have to add a little more sugar
salt not a problem so that's just day
one I'm going to do a follow up video
will seal these up in a jar
and then we'll actually use them in food
if you want to play along at home go to
the site get the ingredients and start
your batch and we will cook with chewed
lemons together and as always enjoy
